dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A murky green pond dotted with floating litter. NADINE ROSTAMI (16) skinny, self-conscious posture, a fac that hasn't quite grown into her nose, stands on the pond BRIDGE staring into the muck. She clutches a LARGE DUFFLE and talks into her CELL PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I just called to tell you I'm chucking everything you ever gave me into the Norfolk pond. Yes, that disgusting scummy festering cesspool they haven't drained in a hundred years and that has like 8 Cheeto bags and a dead squirrel floating in it right this very moment. Every birthday present, all our pictures, that Canada sweatshirt you got me from Canada that's my favorite because the inside is still fuzzy after a billion washes... yeah, even that. That's how dead serious I am. I just have one last thing to say to you so listen closely because I'm not going to repeat myself: I nev--

dialogues.speaker: VOICEMAIL LADY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Thank you. Your message has been sent.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Motherfucker. Nadine's not sure what to do. This really blows. After a beat, she dials again. BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's Krista, leave a message and try to keep it short because I think I have ADD. No, I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Your stupid voicemail lady cut me off and it wasn't very good fricking timing. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyway, as I was saying: I'm never talking to you again. This friendship... is officially over. She hangs up and unzips the bag, ready to dump its conten when we:

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Krista and I had been best friends since the day we met back in the Spring of 2nd grade. Crouched under the PLASTIC SLIDE, we find LITTLE NADINE ( heavy brows and the faintest hint of a mustache even at t age, and LITTLE KRISTA (6), blonde, chubby, glasses an in thick, playing Barbies together. Nadine has KEN's pants o and is making him hump Krista's SKIPPER doll.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: My name's Krista, what's yours?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Nadine Hamidi Yousefa Rostami.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: (impressed) Wow, that's abuncha words. You're real good at the Ken, too.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You think so? Krista smiles. Nadine beams, making Ken hump even faster. Then, an idea:

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, you wanna be best friends?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Sounds good to me I guess.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And that was it.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: From that day forward, we were inseparable. Covered in head-to-toe protective pads, Nadine and Krista nervously roller-skate down the sidewalk, holding each other's hands for support, both horribly uncoordinated. Nadine's older brother, DARIAN (8), bikes by with his friends.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DARIAN
dialogues.text: (startling them) Lesbos!!! They lose their balance and eat it.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We started doing everything alike. Dressed in matching SHREK COSTUMES, they rush up to a doorstep, sticking out their plastic pumpkins for candy.

dialogues.speaker: SUBURBAN MOM
dialogues.text: Aww, you boys make such adorable ogres.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We learned new things together. Now 9-years-old, Nadine and Krista are frozen in front of television, their eyes as big as baseballs. Turn to reveal: They found the CINEMAX channel. Darian suddenly pops up from behind the couch.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE DARIAN
dialogues.text: You big fat perverted molesters! I'm telling mom!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And kept nothing secret. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now 12-years-old, a taller, lankier Nadine gets up off th toilet, looks down into the bowl and SCREAMS. She rips open the stall door and frantically calls Krista inside, their faces awash with amazement and disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone box of ULTRA ABSORBENT MAXI-PADS goes by on the conveyer belt. Nadine and Krista hide their faces in magazines as the MALE CASHIER rings them up.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: As we grew up, theoretically, we should've grown apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now 14, Krista trades in her glasses for CONTACT LENSES. smiles for Nadine, showing off the 'new her.'

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: (blinking uncontrollably) Whaddaya think?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (sincerely impressed) Wooocooowwwwww.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ASIAN WOMAN rips a cloth strip off 14-year-old Nadine' upper lip, taking her mustache with it.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (to Krista) Do I still look like him, or is it better now? She holds up a PHOTO of PEDRO FROM NAPOLEON DYNAMITE for comparison. Even without the mustache, the resemblance is uncanny.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You don't look like a small Mexican boy at all anymore. We're so ready for high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine and Krista are all dolled up... and sitting alone the bleachers, guy after guy walking right past them with so much as a glance. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But as it turned out, growing up just made us closer.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck these people. Krista nods in agreement. They head for the door.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That is, until it didn't... RECORD SCREECHES TO A HALT and we END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is sectioned off into cliques: Mean Girls eyeing their manicures and complaining about the heat. Jocks wit their pecks flexed. The Dorks. The Drama Kids. The one pregnant chick and her boyfriend who knows his life is ov aaaaaaaaaand-— Nadine and Krista, now 16, still just the two of them. Na has grown out her Pedro haircut and shaped her brows (shooting for Kim Kardashian but landing somewhere around Mayim Bialik). It's an awkward, grows-on-you kind of cuteness. Krista is blonde, pretty in a tomboy sort of wa wearing a Radiohead t-shirt. They're sitting under a tree with a penis carved into it.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: We have to relocate. The penistree smells like barf.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (eating an enormous burrito) I love the penistree, it's been our spot since freshman year.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Ehh. I feel like we need a change.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That should've been my first clue: Change. But I was too busy scouring the quad for-- Nadine suddenly stops eating her burrito.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (dreamily) Hot Soccer Dan... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's walking out of the cafeteria -- handsome, tan, and wearing a bright red and green RONALDO JERSEY. Time stops the music swells as he runs his fingers through his hair. Nadine gazes at him longingly, mesmerized. All of the sud her burrito SMASHES INTO HER FACE, beans and rice everywh

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell, idiot?! Nadine's brother, Darian, cracks up. He's now 18, buff, gorgeous, and insanely popular. He and his buddy FUTCH (1 linebacker's build, carry JACK IN BOX bags.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Oh sorry, did I bump you? Tell mom I'll be home late, Futch is having a party.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (wiping burrito off her cheek) Screw you, tell her your gay self!

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: You should try smiling more, it's good for you.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You should try.... not sucking more! And not being so dumb and retarded...more. Darian frowns at her pitiful comeback. Feels bad for her.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: I love you, Nadine. Nadine rolls her eyes, watches as Darian walks over to th FLAGPOLE where the popular people hang out. Every single person stops what they're doing to greet Darian The King. owns this school. CARLY CORVETTI (17), vampire-gorgeous with a hint of craz makes tragic bedroom eyes at him. He hardly notices. THREE SOPHOMORE GIRLS approach Nadine.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHOMORE GIRL
dialogues.text: Excuse me, is that true? You're Darian Rostami's little sister? She gets it. They think she's cool just by association. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. Yeah, I am.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHOMORE GIRL
dialogues.text: Wow! You guys are so different, it's almost like-- (turns to her friends) What's that old movie where it turns out Arnold Schwarzenegger is twins with that short fat bald guy? (friends have no idea) You know! It's on TBS a lot, it's from the 80's? And Arnold's like big and buff and good-looking and cool? And then his twin is just like the leftover waste of genetic shit? (they still have no idea) Come on, I know you guys know this!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Twins. The fucking movie is called Twins.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHOMORE GIRL
dialogues.text: Twins! Exactly, exactly! (realizes) I mean, but no offense... Nadine's smidgen of confidence has already been squashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine and Krista play a round of minigolf.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I hate every single person we go to school with.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, those girls are morons.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: And my stupid brother. I just want to kick his annoying face off.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: No, I was just wondering if that's possible. Kicking someone's face off.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Sure. Let's say I'm like a small Asian Karate master and I just keep kicking his face and kicking his face, bah! bah! bah!, and then finally after like 45 minutes, his face is all bloody and mutilated and dangling off the bone like roast beef and shit. Uh huh, absolutely possible. 100%.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. Yeah, I'll buy that.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Anyway, whatever, let's not talk about him. Hey, so I had an idea for us for prom.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Get this. Hot dog suits. Matching ones. It'll be awesome, ‘cause it'll be like, "Hey fuckers, You know how much we give a shit about prom? We're dressed like pork wieners, that's how much." You know what I'm saying?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: That's awesome, I love it.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Me too, me too. Is it kinda pathetic, though? I don't wanna look pathetic, ya know?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: No, no. It's badass. We're totally doing it. Nadine grins.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nadine, is that you? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine spins around to find ERWIN KIM (16), Korean, stoop shouldered, velcro sandals with socks.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh, hey....(searching)...Korean guy from my Chem Class.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: It's Erwin. Erwin Kim.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Yep, yeah. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Oh nothin', you know, just hanging with my bros... (butchers it) Chillizzillin'...like a bowwss. Just then, ERWIN'S PARENTS bark at him in Korean, gesturi for him to rejoin their game. He pretends that didn't jus happen.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyway, so, uh, you know that tree you guys always sit under? I took too much Tylenol Cold and accidentally puked my lunch down the trunk the other day. I was aiming for the trash can, sorry. Krista gives Nadine a "toldja" look.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: We appreciate the honesty.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: And, um, also...I really like your sweatshirt, Nadine. It's nice. She's wearing the CANADA SWEATSHIRT.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: So's your hair and shoes and eyes and teeth and socks.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Wow. Okay. Thanks. Erwin turns red, realizing that might have been overkill. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: ‘kay, I gotta get back to my friends now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine and Krista and sprawled out on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Erwin Kim is your new lover.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: He totally imagines you undressing him. Sloooooowly un-velcroing his man-sandals.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Whatever. That guy on youtube with the hundred pound Elephantitis balls is your new lover.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Aww, I feel sorry for that guy.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I know, me too. Sometimes I drift off in class and I'm just like, ",..that poor man and his poor big balls, what's he doing right now?"

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You know what, screw it, for twenty million bucks, I would be his lover. Okay, maybe not lover, but I'd give him a real quick handjob just to be nice and make his day.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Wow, I had no idea you were such a humanitarian, Krista.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I try to ask myself What Would Jesus Do... They both laugh. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: But if I'd been paying attention, I'd have known that Krista feeling uncharacteristically charitable in the Handy Department was actually clue number two. Through the front door comes Nadine's mom, MONA (43), poo hair, wearing every piece of jewelry she owns. Her boyfri JERRY (45) follows behind, a muscled-out gym rat in a too tight Hawaiian shirt.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, how was The Olive Garden?

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Great. I ate 400 breadsticks and Jerry shared some really exciting news.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (not interested) That's nice.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Well I didn't want to make a huge deal of it, but... I was offered a pretty sweet job today.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (perks up) Oh really? Like what kind of job?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As long it was in any other field. ANY. OTHER. FIELD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry rolls up in a THREE WHEELER METER MAID VEHICLE to p up Nadine from school, still in his weight-lifting gloves

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (mortified) I said I'd take the bus! Jerry spots somebody doing something illegal.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: What's this dipshit doing? Hey dipshit! (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you not see the Loading Zone sign, or are you just an asshole? Nadine looks up to see he's yelling at a NICE LITTLE OLD wearing a sweater with dancing penguins on it, who works the front office. Hot Soccer Dan is observing all this, t She sinks into her seat, dying.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Parking Enforcement offered me a job at headquarters. No more work on the route for this guy.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: No more work on the route?! Are you serious?!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Got my own office now and everything. Big desk, new computer, window. (then) Phone, printer, eraser board, carpet, automatic hole punch, stapler, pack of multi-color Sharpies. Hole punch.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Wow, sounds like you're really runnin' shit, Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Anyway, we think this calls for a mini-vacation. Drive up to Santa Barbara for the weekend to celebrate, whaddaya say?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Can Krista come?

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: You'll have to talk to Darian. Corolla only seats five and he'll probably want to bring Futch. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh screw Futch. How's that fair? Darian's out getting wasted with a bunch of dumb sluts, I'm here drinking Diet Sprite with my parents. I'm the good child, I should be rewarded.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: How about I flip a coin. Heads, Krista. Tales, Futch.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: No. No way. That's totally un--

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (already flipped it) Heads. Krista wins.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Ha! Yes! Darian can suck it! (mimes him sucking it) He can suck it, suck it, suuuck it. Aww yeah. And then slap it. Slap it. Really slap it. (mimes slapping it)

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Slap it? Why slap it?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (walks away) I'm a winner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pack up the car for the trip.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: A coin toss doesn't count if I'm not there for it.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You lost. Sorry, loser. Nadine heads inside for her bag, Krista gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Mom, let's talk about this, I don't thin-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Oh give it up, Darian. You've been cut enough breaks in life, let your poor sister at least have this.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Jeez, mom, you make me sound like some kind of reject.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Sorry. I thought you went inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all piled in the car, on the way. No.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: What's the address up there, anyway? I told my mom I'd text her.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh, change of plans.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: What? No more Santa Barbara?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Well, I thought about it and I was like, you know what, we could go there anytime. Let's go somewhere really special. Somewhere incredible, somewhere we'1ll--

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (cuts to the chase) Casino Morongo.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: We're going to an Indian Casino?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: With a buffet that's going to knock your socks off. You guys like seafood?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA NADINE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then they've got a hell of a swimming pool.  15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 112 degrees out and the pool is UNDER RENOVATION.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Whoops, maybe shoulda called first.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Gallagher's performing, you guys should go see him.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Who's Gallagher?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: He's a comedian from the 80's. He smashes fruit with a big hammer.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: And that's funny?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Of course it is, fruit's goddamn hilarious. Welp, we'll be at the blackjack table.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Wear sunscreen and just because you got your own room doesn't mean you can charge crap to it. They head off, leaving them. Darian starts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: God I'm so bummed Futch isn't here for this raging fun time.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh shut up.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: You know, I don't know how it's possible, but even when I lose, I still manage to win.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You didn't win, Darian. You did not win in any way, shape, or form.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: He really kinda did, though, didn't he? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Krista. Jeez.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: I don't know, I think God just watches out for me, ya know? I'm like his little buddy. I'm like Jesus Christ with a cooler haircut. Nadine just stares at him a beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: This is officially it. Tonight is the night I kill you in your sleep and feel no remorse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They linger outside the casino, coming up with a plan.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: So how are we doing this again?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: We just calmly, slowly stroll past security. Don't walk fast, it's suspicious. Just a nice casual stroll.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: You guys are so dumb if you think anyone'll buy you're 21.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Hey, you're lucky we're even letting you hang out with us, okay?

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, I'm real lucky.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You are. You'd have nothing to do. You'd have to watch Gallagher, that's how fucked you'd be!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: So after we stroll in?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Right, so once we're in ear shot of the guards, you'll be all like, (fake adult voice) (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Ahhh, income tax sucks so hard" and I'm like, "you should see my commute to the office." And then we order Vodka Gimlets and bitch about our husbands pissing on the seat.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: We have husbands? Are they hot?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: They're both insanely hot model- slash-Veterinarians. Come on, balls to the wall, let's do this. They go in for the kill. They almost make it to a slot machine when a MAN IN A SUIT (40's) approaches.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN SUIT
dialogues.text: Excuse me, ladies, can I--

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (immediately) We're underage, I'm so sorry!!!

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN SUIT
dialogues.text: (trails off) «--get...you a drink...

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Shit. (then, why not) Two Vodka Gimlets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them sit in a booth, Darian eats a crab.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Well, I'm amazed. I'm just absolutely amazed that didn't work.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You know what? I hope that crab wakes up and punches you in the face.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: You hope it wakes up? It's dead, not sleeping. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I hope that crab miraculously comes back to life and claws the fucking shit out of your face and pokes out your eyeballs and then takes a big dump on your head.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: That's pretty elaborate for a crab, wow.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Maybe they have a deck of cards in the gift shop. We could play Spoons or something.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: We're not playing Spoons.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: What's wrong with Spoons?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: It's stupid and it's not fun, and we're gonna have fun even if it freaking sucks! enters from the back room dollying a case of JIM BEAM towards the bar.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold on. I have an idea. Nadine gets up, trying to formulate a plan. She's got it. jogs overs to the bus boy, frantically taps his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir, that lady is choking! Please, quick, you've gotta help her!

dialogues.speaker: BUSBOY
dialogues.text: Who? What lady?!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: The elderly woman with the oxygen tank! He turns to look, and the entire restaurant is elderly wo with oxygen tanks. As he runs off to find the victim, Nad quickly snakes a couple of bottles.  19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine does a dance, sloshing booze into their cups.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Who is awesome?! Who is just one big fat awesomesauce sandwich with extra awesome dressing?

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Okay, you did good, shut up.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: (checks the mini-fridge) We need a mixer, what's in here?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Not me, I have gum.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Gum? Are you retarded? You can't use gum as a mixer.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Yes you can, you mix it with your spit the old fashion way. I've seen it done on TV like a thousand times.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: No you haven't, who's ever done that even once?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Like basically everyone who's not a big gigantic pussy, okay! (knocks back a shot, grimaces)

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Nadine, you better pace yourself.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (pouring herself another) Thanks, mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine is curled up in the bathtub, hammered and suddenly a very dark place. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You know what my problem is in life? I've really been thinking about this a lot... It's my head. Krista leans against the opposite wall, only slightly les inebriated.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: What's going on in your head?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: No, no, my actual head. My skull. It's too small. Before I thought my nose was too big, but now I'm thinking it's actually just that my head's too small. It makes me look ridiculous. I think that's why no guy I like ever likes me, like Hot Soccer Dan. And here's the really fucked up part, okay? There's no surgery for it. Even if I win the lotto or become the first female president, I'll still be stuck with a weird little shrunken Beetlejuice head for the rest of my life. And then I think... why even go on?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You do this every time you drink, Nadine. Get all depressed.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: No I do not! I do not! Yes I do. I do, I'm a depressed person with a big nose and a tennis ball head and that's the truth. I'm gonna barf right here down the bathtub drain.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Okay. Nadine leans over and pukes.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: That was good. And you wanna know the other thing, too?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: What? But when Krista looks over, Nadine's passed out cold. She rolls up a towel, wedges it under Nadine's head as a pill
Darian lies on the bed, watching TV, pretty wasted. Krist stumbles in, trying to keep her balance.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: I'm boning a Pygmy goat.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Um, okay.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Hey, you know that joke I told earlier about the Pygmy goat and how I was boning it, but I really wasn't because I was watching Antique Roadshow instead?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: That was hilarious.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: It was pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Come're. She walks over and Darian fills up her cup, then his.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cheers. My sister passed out?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I think she had too much.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Do me a huge favor and take my socks off for me?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Ew, no.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Please. I'd do it myself but they're so far away from my hands. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I'm not touching your gross socks, Darian.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: I'll give you a million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You don't have a million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: I'll rob a bank.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You'll go to jail.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Then I'1ll-- OH SHHHHIT!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Oh, no way. I'm gonna kill her.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: What? He sits up and turns his head around to reveal: Nadine's is stuck in the back of his hair. Krista starts cracking

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: I knew I smelled peppermint! Aw crap, it's all matted in there, too.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You need peanut butter.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Where am I gonna get peanut butter?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You need ice. Hold on. Come here. She stumbles over to the ICE BUCKET, brings it back and p down right next to him on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: (re: her sudden close proximity) Well, okay then. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Oh stop it.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: I'm not saying anything.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Shhh. Hold still. She applies an ice cube to the gum.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Did it work?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: It's been one second.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: (one more second) Did it work now?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I'm gonna kill you. He smirks.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Wow, I've never seen you this up close. It's like I flipped over to Krista HD. Helloooooo, pores.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: (feeling exposed) Oh god, jeez.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: No, it's interesting. You have a major shitload of freckles, too.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: You're Irish, right? (singing, high-pitch Irish accent) Oh Danny boy, the pipes, the pipes are callin’... That song's Irish, isn't it? (awful "big band" voice) From glen to glen, and down the mountain side. That was with a Sinatra twist that time. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: It's amazing you're not in glee club.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: I thought about it, but then I was like, you know, the hours, the commitment, having to tell my mom I'm gay... Krista practically spits up her drink laughing. She takes some of his hair with her.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ouch, Jesus, you just ripped out half my scalp!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: (still laughing) Sorry sorry sorry! He watches her laugh, liking this side of her.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Oh my god, and you totally laugh like Fran Drescher.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: (laughs more) No I do not!

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: No, you really do though.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Hey, you better be nice to me, I could leave this thing where it's at.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: You're right, I apologize, your laughter is like harp music. How we doing back there? Progress?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Open your hand. Krista deposits the HAIRY PIECE OF GUM into it.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Wow, that is...that is... just horribly disgusting. (then, uber dramatic) (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to keep it for the rest of life.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: In a jar, on my shelf, and every time I look at it, I'll think of... well, probably not you, actually. I'll probably just be like, "Ew, shit, that gum's still there?!" She laughs again. He smiles. And then, before either of t knows what's happening, he's kissing her. Krista pulls aw shocked.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Whoa! What the fuck, what the fuck, what the fuh-uh-uck?!

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: I don't know, I don't know, that was weird, I don't know! They just look at each other for a second, freaked out. T just as quickly they're all over each other again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car ride back. It's eerily silent. Nadine stares at Krista, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Something's weird.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Hmmm?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Something's weird, I can't put my finger on it, but something's off. It's a vibe.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Maybe you're car sick.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: That's not it.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Did you eat something bad? Maybe your bacon was tainted. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: My bacon was outstanding. My bacon's never been anything short of it.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I have no idea then. Darian just stares straight ahead, not saying a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine sits on the rim of the toilet, trying to digest th

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I am so, so, so, so, so sorry! I don't know how it happened!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Oh my god, I can't breathe. It's like, I wanna puke but I also wanna gouge my eyes out and I don't know which to do first!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I should've told you earlier, I feel terrible!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: How far are we talking about here? No, don't tell me. Yes, tell me. No, don't.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: It wasn't that far, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: How far is not far? Second base?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Uhhhhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Nooooo! You went all the way to third base?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Oh god, I'm so sorry!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: A handjob?! You gave my brother a handjob?! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: It was a really quick one though! Like the fastest I've ever rubbed one out in my life, I'm serious!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (covers her ears) Oh god oh god oh god! La la la la!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I'll shut up, I'll just shut up! Nadine gets a hold of herself.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Okay... I'm okay... (beat) Wait a minute. Don't tell me you actually like him?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: What? Noooooooo. I was drunk. I was out of my mind.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Because he's a gigantic asshat, Krista.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Like, the gigantic-est.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: And he farts constantly. And he sticks his finger in his bellybutton and then sniffs it.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: He does?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Like. It's. His. Job. Krista looks horrified.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I don't like him, okay? Trust me, I don't like him one bit.  28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darian's walking to class with Futch when Nadine corners

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Why don't you just go ahead and grow yourself a little mustache, huh Darian?

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Just grow a little mustache and start hanging out in a park bathroom with a bag of candy because that's what you are: one big Molestersaurus Rex.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Oh Christ, are you kidding me? She turns to Futch.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: That's right, Futch, your best friend took advantage of an innocent girl and scarred her for life.

dialogues.speaker: FUTCH
dialogues.text: Okay, I don't what you're saying, but you sound like a dumbass.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Hey. I'm the only who calls my sister a dumbass.

dialogues.speaker: FUTCH
dialogues.text: (immediately) Totally kidding, Nadine.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Whatever. Just know this, Darian. Know this and never forget it: (long dramatic pause) You...are...gross. She turns and walks off. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I really wanted to exit on a better insult than that, but my hamster brain wasn't giving me shit. Tomorrow in the shower I'll come up with like 50 zingers. I always do my best thinking in the shower. For instance this morning it occurred to me that if my hair is bigger, it'll create the illusion that my head is actually bigger. Who knows, Maybe even normal-sized. Just then, somebody slams into Nadine from behind. Her CHEMISTY BOOK goes flying.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, watch where you're-- But it's HOT SOCCER DAN.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh -- (immediately fluffs up her hair) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: HOT SOCCER DAN
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'm late to my class. He picks the book up, hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Yeah, no, that's completely alright and cool. He keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, and um, my name's-- But he's about 40 feet down the hall now. She curses hers

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Daaaah! Quicker, you have to be quicker!

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: What's wrong? You look all-- (makes a frazzled face)

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Nothing. Crap, I just remembered I forgot to do my Chem homework. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: You can copy mine.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, why not?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: No, I just feel bad. I feel like you shouldn't just let me do that, Erwin.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Okay, then you can't then.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (beat) Maybe if I just copy like 90% and guess on the rest? That's not really cheating. He hands it to her. She looks at it a sec, then:

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, listen. I feel like maybe I should go ahead and clear something up though. I get the sense you might have a little, I don't know, crush on me, so I just want to be up front: I don't really see you like that. Like at all.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Um. Okay. But you don't even know me.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: That's true.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: I mean, what if you get to know me and you're all like, "oh wow, Erwin's even funnier than Will Ferrell in that one movie." Or "Whoa, Erwin's brain's so big he makes Einstein look like a dumb- dumb." What then?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Did you just use the word "dumb- dumb"? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Okay, fine. Are you funnier than Will Ferrell? Do you make Einstein look dumb?

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: No, but once I rode my bike really fast with my eyes closed and I eat a frigging serious lot of lactose despite my intolerance.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Uh huh. I'm probably gonna stick with my original plan. Sorry. Do you want this back then? She holds up his homework.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: / KRISTA'S LOCKER
dialogues.text: Krista digs through her locker - it's wallpapered with AL PACINO pictures. Al in The Godfather, Al in Scarface, Al holding his Oscar. Darian approaches.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Why would you think it was a good idea to tell my sister that?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: She's my best friend, I tell her everything.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: And I love how you twisted it into me taking advantage of you when you know it was you who was all up in my bidnass.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Oh yeah right, in your dreams!

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: You were! You were basically like, Oh, Darian. Let me help you get that gum out of your hair... (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (imitates her, licking his lips and rubbing his nipples)

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I've never done that nipple move in my life and you didn't even say one word to me the whole next day!

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Well I wanted to, but it was weird! Krista exhales. They just stand there a beat.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So you wanna grab a burger tonight?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: What kind of burger.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Cheese. No cheese.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Um... okay.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Come by around 7, I'll be back from practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine is spraying her hair into what basically amounts t beehive, but not that good. She's checking herself out fr every angle. Darian walks in, sweaty from football.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: I need to get in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Nope. She keeps teasing her hair, eyeing herself.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: ‘kay. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He walks past her, picks up the TOILET BRUSH, rubs it aro in the toilet water and points the dripping bristles at h

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (inching away from it) Whoa whoa whoa! He forces her right out the door, SLAMS it shut, locks it

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A bristle hit my thumb, you idiot! I hope I die of e-coli just so you feel guilty the rest of your life! The DOORBELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine opens it to find Krista at the threshold.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Uh, well--

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: It's good, I need your help with my hair. I know it looks like a rat's nest, but is it in a cool, hip, Amy Winehouse kind of way? Or more just like "hi, the mental hospital confiscated my hairbrush"? Be honest.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I think maybe more the second one.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Crap, I kinda thought so. Krista steps inside. Nadine heads up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, so any word if your mom's friend can sew the hotdog suits for us?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's gonna make ‘em out of polyfiber foam, that way they'll bend and breathe but still maintain their hotdoggy shape. Cool, right? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Love it. Genius. (realizes) Why are you still standing there? Come upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Uh... well, actually, I need to tell you something, and I don't know how you're going to take it. Nadine freezes.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh no, is Hot Soccer Dan in a coma? Oh god.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: No, no, he's fine. It's just that... I didn't really come here to hang out.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I came here to grab a burger. (beat) With your brother. Nadine says nothing. Absolutely nothing.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know. I know. This is very weird. And I know I said I didn't like him. But then he asked me to get a burger. And then I said yes. And then... Well that's pretty much the whole story actually.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Like...like a date?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: No, I don't think it's a date. I think it's more just two people casually enjoying ground beef on a bun together.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: That sounds like every date I've ever imagined being on. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Darian comes down the stairs, all spruced up for the date

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god he has his good jeans on!

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: See you later, Nader. As they head out the door, Krista turns back to Nadine.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Tell me you're okay and you're not pissed. Nadine just stands there. Wordless, awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Eh, she's fine. He shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine eats breakfast as Krista tentatively approaches.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Hey. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Fine. You?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Good. Hashbrown square? She takes one, eyeing Nadine.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You're being weird.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: No I'm not. I just offered you a hashbrown square, how's that weird?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: This isn't you. It's like a Terminator-version of you and I'm supposed to think it's you, but I can tell it's really a computerized look-a-like sent from the future to offer me hashbrowns and eat my brains. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Eat your brains? When does the Terminator eat anyone's brains?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Stop bullshitting me, Nadine.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say? You get drunk, you hook up with my brother, then you go on a date and don't even have the decency to call me from the bathroom!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You wanted me to call you from the bathroom, that's what you're mad about?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You always call me from the bathroom on dates. Don't act like this is new!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: The circumstances were a little different this time!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: So is he your boyfriend now? You guys are like an item all the sudden?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: It was one date.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: So it was a date!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Oh my god, Nadine.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I'm not comfortable with this. I'm not comfortable with it at all.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: So what do you want me to do then?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I want you to never go out with him again. He's my brother. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's off limits. I don't like it and that's it! Krista stands there a second, thinking this over. Finally

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (beat) Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Yes. Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Sweet. (beat) ‘nother hashbrown square?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine stands under the penis tree spraying a CAN OF DISINFECTANT. Krista walks up.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I think I've almost stamped out the Erwin barf smell for good. This stuff is industrial grade, they use it on bum piss at the Third Street Promenade.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I take it back.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You take what back.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I'm not not-seeing your brother. I've been thinking about this and you really like peanut butter cups, right? Well, I would never ask you to stop eating them just because they make me uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: What? That's the worst analogy I've ever heard. First of all, my brother isn't a scrumptious chocolate snack, and second, how can peanut butter cups make you uncomfortable? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Lots of ways. Maybe I have a peanut allergy. Maybe I just have nightmares about them jumping down my throat and clogging up my arteries.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: That's crazy! They're not even that fatty! Whatever, you know what, fine. I would, I would never touch another goddamn peanut butter cup as long as I live just for you. In fact, I'd have them all put ona big boat and dumped in the middle of the ocean because that's just how much of a good freaking friend I am!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: That would do nothing! That would just kill a whole bunch of sea life!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I'd kill that sea life in the name of our friendship! I'd murder fish to make you happy! Krista rubs her temples, sighs.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: He asked me to go lunch at Jack In The Box and I want to go, and I want you to come with us.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: No. I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: No way in hell, Krista! I'd rather eat alone! I'd rather sit here all alone under this tree, just me and the penis and this can of disinfectant!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Nadine-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: No, you know what? Go ahead! Have a blast with Darian at Jack In The Box because apparently that's what you want to do sooooo bad!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Are you seriously being this dramatic?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Go! See ya later! G'bye, Krista! Krista hangs there a moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Fine. I will. She turns and leaves. Nadine watches her go, then sits a under the tree. She looks up at the penis carving, then o at the disinfectant. A group of SENIORS walk by, eyeing h sitting there all alone.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (blurts self-consciously) I'm waiting for someone! Another moment passes. We go to an ultra-wide shot of Nad as a tiny little dot, the only person eating by herself i the whole entire school. She can't handle it.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dahhh!!! She immediately grabs her stuff, runs after Krista.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista and Darian are up front. Nadine is scrunched in th cab, straddling his STINKY PILE OF FOOTBALL PADS.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You okay back there? The wind is tearing through the windows, whipping Nadine' hair all over the place and stirring up the B.0. stink.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I'm wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: How do those football pads smell? Glad you tagged along, sis? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (not giving him the satisfaction) I don't smell anything whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carly Corvetti gets up from a table of her TWO ALMOST-AS- FRIENDS, saunters over.

dialogues.speaker: CARLY
dialogues.text: Well, look who's here...

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Can't keep me away from those curly fries, Carly.

dialogues.speaker: CARLY
dialogues.text: Curly fries are my favorite. They remind me of something I just had completely waxed off. Darian raises his eyebrows. Carly smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: CARLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're just leaving, but you're coming to my party next week, right? And I don't think I've met your new little friends... Darian puts his arm around Krista, pulls her towards him.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: This... would be Krista. Carly grins at Krista, but her face says, "You're having lunch with this chick?"

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And that would be her friend, Nadine. Who also happens to be my sister.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (pops out from behind him) Helloooooo Miss Lady. (no response) From Step Brothers? No? (beat) Congratulations on your pubes.  41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them eat their lunch. No one's talking.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: So this is what you guys did last night? Silently chewed your food and stared at each other? It's a real blast, lemme tell ya.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Did you ever think that maybe it's awkward because you're sitting here?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I'm impeding your conversation then?

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: And what would you be talking about that you couldn't say in front of me? Darian lifts his eyebrows, looks at Krista conspiratorial

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ew. You talk about your balls or something? Is that what you guys do? "Blah blah blah, Darian's balls, Darian's penis, half an hour of Darian's balls and penis" and then you call it an evening?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Pretty much word for word.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Don't be sarcastic right now.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: She's right. There's no reason we shouldn't act exactly the same as we did last night. (acting the same) Hey, Krista?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Yeah? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: You've got some sauce on your chin. He leans over and runs his tongue all the way up her face slowly licking it off. Krista lets out a loud laugh, punc him in the arm. Nadine throws her chicken sandwich down, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You. Sick. Motherfuckers.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: He did that for show. That didn't really happen. Nadine stands up, done.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I'm waiting in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine is slumped on the couch, watching her mom do Wii Aerobics.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: I think it's great. Maybe they'll fall in love and get married and Krista will be your sister like you've always wanted.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Mom. Do not even say that. (looks heavenward) You didn't hear that, Universe!

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: You should have fun with it, why don't you start going out with one of Darian's friends? What about Futch?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I'm not going out with Futch. He's fat and he barely talks and no.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Don't be mean to fat people. Your mother's fat. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You're not fat. Does Jerry tell you that? Is that why you're doing aerobics? I'll kill him.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: No, no, Jerry thinks I'm beautiful. He tells me all the time. Nadine pauses, thinking about that.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: See, that's the thing, isn't it.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You're not beautiful unless somebody thinks you are. Mona turns around, faces her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: I think you're beautiful, Nadine. Nadine just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: That's the most terrible thing you've ever said to me, mom.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Because I -- nevermind. Nadine gets up, leaves the room. Mona frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine steps into the bathroom, closes the door behind he takes a deep breath, then addresses herself.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Nadine, just relax, okay? You're getting all worked up and crazy. This whole thing is going to pass. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In fact, I'll bet you a million bucks it already fizzled out after that bizarro lunch today, I mean you saw them, they have nothing in common. Pretty soon this is going to be one of those things you look back and laugh about, alright little buddy? Yep, you called yourself little buddy, you really did, and that's completely fine because no one heard it except you. She exhales, feeling better.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're gonna be okay. On her way out, something on the bathroom counter catches eye: A BAG FROM RITE AID. She looks inside, curious. MOUTHWASH, OLD SPICE DEODORANT, and AXE BODY SPRAY. She freezes, realizing. The pep talk immediately goes out window, and she bursts out of the bathroom towards Darian

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: What's all that stuff from Rite Aid for? She corners him as he's coming down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Move, you're in the way.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Why do you want to smell so goddamn fresh suddenly, huh?

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Move or I'll do it for you. His CELL PHONE RINGS. He picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh hey, Krista, what's up. Nadine's eyes pop open. He slides right past her into his room.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: What?! That's her? She's calling you? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She tries to stop him, but he's already closed his door a locked her out.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. Uh-uh. No way. She pulls out her own PHONE and dials Krista.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh how funny, I just called your bro, can I call you right back?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: No you can't, Krista. I really don't know how to feel about this whole you suddenly phoning Darian thing.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Okay, I don't really see what the big--

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: The big deal is you can just call me, and after we talk, if there's time, and he's around, and I have any minutes left, I'll maybe consider handing it to him. Suddenly Darian's door flies open, he rips Nadine's cell phone out of her hand, then shuts and locks it again. Nad screams, bangs on the door. Mona walks up just in time to observe this.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Hey watch it, that's nice wood.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: If he thinks I'm just gonna sit back as he steals my best friend and tries to edge me out, he has no idea how wrong he is! No idea! She stomps to her room, SLAMS the door. Mona looks concer She walks over to the door, knocks.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Honey, can I tell you something? It worries me when you're nostril does that thing. There's no answer.  46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darian is introducing Krista to the flagpole crowd. Excep for Carly, they all greet her warmly. HEATHER and EMILIE two cute popular blondes, befriend her immediately.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I love your outfit, your shirt is so cute, where'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Thanks. Forever 21 I think?

dialogues.speaker: EMILIE
dialogues.text: Wow, that's so cool you're not even embarrassed to admit that. We should totally all hang out sometime. Just then, Nadine comes up, squeezes herself between Kris and Darian, puts an arm around each, big smile.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: So where are we going to lunch today, kiddos?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You're in a good mood.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You know, I thought about it more, and I'm actually kind of looking forward to all the time the three of us will be spending together...

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: (Dream on) All the time?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Speaking of which, I know how busy you are Darian, so I went ahead and picked this up for you. She pulls out his NEW MONTH'S PRESCRIPTION OF IBS PILLS, makes a big spectacle of it. He reddens, grabs it away, stuffs it in his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't be embarrassed. A lot of people have IBS. I bet a ton of your friends do, too. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: You better shut your mouth right now, Nad--

dialogues.speaker: HAND IF YOU HAVE IT TOO
dialogues.text: Nobody raises their hand.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Huh. I guess I stand corrected. Darian wants to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At lunch, Nadine monopolizes the conversation with Krista making it impossible for Darian to join in.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: -+. so he dicks her over at the rose ceremony and she's sobbing in the limo and the blonde chick with the Jay Leno chin is just like "oh wow, it's true, he loves me and my chin," but really... Darian's in hell having to listen to this crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darian and Krista watch a scary movie. As the action swel they start to snuggle together, getting cozy. Nadine leans in from out of frame, holds out a box of CAN

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Care for a Milk Dud? It totally kills the moment. Darian grits his teeth. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: (whispers) Does she really have to be here?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: She's my best friend. INT. MALL — DAY Nadine keeps yanking Krista into girlie stores to try stu on, making Darian wait outside the dressing room for them He's bored to death, falling asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darian's on the front porch trying to give Krista a good- night kiss, but can't relax enough to do it, since a few away Nadine has the GARDEN HOSE out, watering the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: You seriously have to do that right now?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Yeah, like the low precipitation is my fault. He rolls his eyes, really tired of dealing with this.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: (to Krista) I'll just see you later. Nadine fights a smile. It's working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erwin and Nadine are lab partners, doing an experiment. S has the spring back in her step.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Did you guys find a new lunch spot or something? I haven't seen you around this week.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: It's a long story.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Oh. Does it have to do with Krista officially becoming girlfriend- boyfriend with Darian? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (immediately looks up) What? When did this happen? That's impossible!

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: I - I'm not sure of the exact time and location. A GOSSIPY GIRL in front of them turns around.

dialogues.speaker: GOSSIPY GIRL
dialogues.text: Yesterday at 11:45 by the flagpole.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I can't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: I kinda can, they've been hanging out a lot.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: And it's been hellish the whole time! God, why would she not tell me? Now they're probably going to that stupid slutty girl's party tonight, too...

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: What stupid slutty girl?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I forget her name. Brown hair, her pubes remind her of curly fries? The GOSSIPY GIRL spins around again.

dialogues.speaker: GOSSIPY GIRL
dialogues.text: Carly Corvetti. She went out with Darian for a week sophomore year before he dumped her and she tried to kill herself with a Schick Quattro. She's never gotten over him. Never. Nadine lets out a groan, puts her head in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Everything sucks. Everything sucks a big wang right now. Erwin thinks a sec. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Okay, but what if tonight you did something really cool to just, you know, get your mind off things? Like we could go to the La Habra Corn Festival where they have rides and games and probably maybe corn? Or we could play mini-golf again? Or go to Souplantation and eat like 45 bowls of soup and just be like, "woooo00e, we're eating so much soup, we're having so much fun, la la la la!" Erwin waves his arms like he's on a roller coaster.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was totally just kidding about all that. Ah ha ha ha...ehh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine eats PEANUT BUTTER CUPS and stares in the mirror, giving herself fake plastic surgery with Q-tips. One in e hand, she pinches her nose to make it smaller, then lifts her eyes, then peels her lips back for an Angelina Jolie effect. It looks ridiculous. Krista stands at her door.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Sorry I didn't tell you earlier, I just wasn't sure how you'd take it.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? I'm so happy for you guys, I think it's great. Nadine puts on a big fake smile. Krista's not sure whethe buy it.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Then why won't you come to this party with us, it'll be fun.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I told you, I just feel like having a night in, ya know? Clean my room... Finally catch up with Harold... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She gestures to Harold, her BETA FISH. She notices he's floating upside down.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Is he okay?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I think that's just how he sleeps. She taps on his tank. Nothing. Maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: (comes out of his room) Let's do it. He heads for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Sure you don't wanna come?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I'm good. Go, go, have fun. Krista hesitates a sec, but Nadine waves her off with a g She leaves and Nadine drops the smile, then moves to her window, watching the two of them walk down the driveway h in hand, Darian sweetly helping Krista into the passenger seat. Something about it makes her feel like absolute shit. There's a KNOCK at the door, Mona and Jerry pop in.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: You're really gonna stay home tonight? Why don't you just tag along with us?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Because I'm having some me-time, why does everyone act like that's so pathetic, it's actually very healthy, okay?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Not if it's a Friday night. That just makes you a loser. Hell, even at our age.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jerry! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: He doesn't mean it like that. Come on, we'll have fun. Believe it or not, your mom is not that awful to hang out with. Nadine thinks about it, not so sure.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: What are you guys gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry and Mona are huddled around the SCRATCHER LOTTO TIC VENDING MACHINE up near the cash registers. They've scrat about 30 tickets and keep shoving dollars into the machin It's poor man's Las Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: (holds up ticket) Oh my god, I won 2 dollars!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Yay! I'll go redeem it with the guy. Here, scratch these, Nadine. He hands her a STRIP OF TICKETS and a DIME for scratching

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: This is where you guys hang out on weekends?

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: We go to Target, too, but you know, they can get all uppity... Mona cracks open a MIKE'S HARD LEMONADE from the 6-pack t just purchased there.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Can you just drink that here, mom?

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Not really. I brought a thermos. She pulls a THERMOS out of her purse. Nadine's in hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total madness. Kids passed out on the lawn, a dude peeing a BIRD FOUNTAIN.  53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Krista and Darian make their way through the party, pe eye her up and down, checking out Darian's new catch. If likes her, she must be hot.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I might be paranoid and just need medication, but I feel like everyone here is staring at me.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: They are. Follow me, I'm gonna grab another beer. As she follows him through the crowd, the SOPHOMORE GIRLS made the Twins comment to Nadine, gaze at her, mesmerized

dialogues.speaker: SOPHOMORE GIRL
dialogues.text: You're so beautiful, your hair's so awesome !

dialogues.speaker: SOPHOMORE GIRL
dialogues.text: I know, and I love how you own your freckles and just said screw it to orthodontia!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Uh, thanks... One of them snaps a cell-phone pic of her, enamored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darian cracks open a beer, hands her one. Just then, Heat runs over from the makeshift dance floor, grabs Krista.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Come on, come dance with us! Before she knows it, she's with a big group of POPULAR GI all dancing in a circle. They cheer, pushing her into the center of it. She's tentative at first, but starts to let having a blast with this newfound popularity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine and Erwin make their way down a giant SOUP BUFFET.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Thanks, I really appreciate it. You didn't have to get all dressed up, honestly. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Erwin's in a FULL-ON SUIT & TIE. He looks like he's going a wedding. And he's incredibly nervous.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no, I was just -- I was just dressed like this when you called. Nadine nods, not buying it. She moves down the buffet lin

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Mmm, clam chowder.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Ooh, I love clam, I could eat clam all night long. (eyes bulge, realizing) No! I didn't mean it like that. I seriously meant the real clam, not the other clam! No, I mean the other one is fine, too, it's great! (beat) What I'm trying to tell you is that I like shellfish and I also like the other shellfish -- at least hypothetically -- but only one of those things would I announce at full volume in the Souplantation. Nadine just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Erwin?

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Let's not have anymore caffeine tonight.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: (nods ) Just water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erwin munches on a GIANT EAR OF CORN while Nadine eats CHOCOLATE COVERED BACON. They wait in line for the FERRIS WHEEL. Erwin's relaxed a little. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You know, I thought chocolate bacon would be bad, and I'm surprised to say: It's actually worse than that. It's just a total miss on every level.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: It's not your fault. Unless you invented it?

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: No. That was not me.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: That was a joke. I didn't actually think you invented chocolate bacon.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Okay. It's their turn. They buckle up in the FERRIS WHEEL.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here we go...

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (as it takes off) Wooooo0o0! They reach the top.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Wow, look at that view... TREES and BUILDINGS are completely blocking the view. Nad laughs.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I think I can see Catalina... Erwin smiles. They settle in.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, tell me something while we're on the ferris wheel. What are your hopes and dreams, Erwin? What do want out of life? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know. I'm just an average guy I guess.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: But if you had to expand for the two minutes we're on this ride.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Well, I guess I do kinda wish people at school didn't just automatically stereotype me as the nerdy Asian kid... There's a lot more to me than that, and I feel like if they could see it, they'd realize I'm actually, well... kinda cool even.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Yeah? Like how?

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: I'm mean, not to brag or sound totally full of myself, but, for instance... I'm a crazy talented flautist.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: As in... you play the flute?

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Not just boring Mozart stuff, I can play anything, I really jam on that thing. Not to brag. Another beat.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: This is just a suggestion, Erwin, but if the goal is to up your cool factor, I'm not exactly sure "flautist" is the best approach. Erwin shrugs. Yeah, maybe not... She sighs,

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: How about you? What do you want out of life? looks off. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just 57. (3)

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I like animals a lot. We don't really have any except for a cat who shits a bunch and it gets old. Someday I'd really love to own a monkey...

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: A monkey?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: They're illegal, it's almost impossible, I'd have to get like 20 permits. I've thought about buying one off the internet, but I read about this girl who spent her life savings to get a Squirrel Monkey from Thailand and then it died 2 days later. That story depressed the crap out of me, I couldn't get out of bed for days.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: That's terrible. I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: It's okay. sort of sit there a second, reflecting on that. Erwin leans over and open-mouth kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pushing him off) What the hell are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: What?! I don't know! Was that bad timing?! I thought that was good timing? We're on the ferris wheel, you were sad about the monkey, I was comforting you?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh. My. God.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Okay. Sorry. That was weird then. That was bad.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: We gotta get off this thing. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: (as they near the bottom) Excuse me, sir, can you let us off? She'd like to be let-- But they keep going around for another turn.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: It's fine. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: No, I feel awful. I'm gonna make it up to you. I don't know how yet, but I am. (beat) Maybe I should pay you.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You're not paying me.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Not. No I am not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista is still dancing with the popular girls when acros the room, she notices Carly standing close to Darian, flirting it up. Heather sees it, too.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Yeah, you prob'ly want to break that up, actually. Carly's kind of a massive ho if the way her labia's hanging out of her shorts hadn't clued you in. Krista observes them, a little uncomfortable. She finally goes over.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Hey... Carly backs off a little, fake-smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CARLY
dialogues.text: Oh hi.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Tearin' it up out there. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CARLY
dialogues.text: I know, your forehead-sweat is like hello. (fake laughs) Krista wipes her face, self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: You look great. You ready to get out of here soon?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: CARLY
dialogues.text: Seriously? It's barely lam.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: I'm an old man, Carly. I can't keep up with you.

dialogues.speaker: CARLY
dialogues.text: So that was the problem? Darian gives her a look, puts his arm around Krista.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Thanks for the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erwin pulls his parents' MINI VAN in front of Nadine's ho

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: I had a good time.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Me, too. Thanks again. See you Monday?

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: (smiles, thumbs up) Monday funday. Nadine jumps out and Erwin waves goodbye. As soon as she closes the door, his smile drops.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're an idiot and you're going to go kill yourself now, okay? Okay.  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is dark and quiet. Nadine puts down her stuff, stands there a moment, not sure what to do. She flips on HOME COMPUTER, logs onto Facebook... She scrolls through Status Updates and Mobile Uploads -- everyone in the entire world is having more fun than she She clicks on DAN GODWIN'S PAGE (Hot Soccer Dan), her cur hangs over the SEND FRIEND REQUEST BUTTON for a moment. S chickens out, goes back to the home page. AND THAT'S WHERE SHE SEES IT: "Krista Kaller has changed profile picture." She clicks it open to see: It's gone from a pic of Krista Nadine, to a PIC OF KRISTA AND DARIAN uploaded at the par They couldn't look happier. Nadine stares at it in disbelief. Pissed, she goes to her page, clicks "UPLOAD NEW PROFILE PIC," then opens her iPh searching for a pic of herself with someone other than Krista. Except... they're ALL with Krista. She closes iPhoto, frustrated. Drums her nails. Then boom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry teaches Nadine to play CROQUET. Mona sunbathes near

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: So what you wanna do is line this up real straight and keep your eyes on the thingy, you see? Now just take a little swing... Nadine hits the ball and it goes right through the thingy

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See! See that?! Ha!
