I always said to your mom, I don't understand why the kids won't play croquet with me, croquet's a damn good time, it's a game of-- Nadine's CELL PHONE rings and she abandons Jerry mid- sentence. Fishing it out of her purse, she lets it ring a more times, before: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (sooooco nonchalant) Oh hey Krista... INT. KRISTA'S BEDROOM —- CONTINUOUS Krista sits at her desk in front of her LAPTOP. between the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: So I saw you changed your profile picture.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh... did I? Yeah, I guess I did.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I'm...not really sure what to say about it. 61. Intercut Krista leans into her computer screen, getting a closer l In the pic, Nadine is hanging out at Golf N Stuff with he arm around...AL PACINO. It's a pretty good Photoshop job, the dimensions are still slightly off.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm still pretty speechless myself...

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You photoshopped yourself at Golf N Stuff with my favorite actor.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: How do you know I photoshopped it? You don't know that.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: He's wearing a tuxedo.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: So. So what. He's Al Pacino, he's very comfortable in formal wear.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Nadine.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Listen, I've just been thinking a lot lately, okay? And the thing is, last night I realized something important. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: And what's that.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: We're not Siamese twins, so we have to stop acting like them.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Okay...?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: It's not like we share a torso and since you decided to become a country singer I just have to stand there smiling and playing the tambourine even though I hate country music and I'm only doing it because you have the liver.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: What are you trying to say right now?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: My point is, we're too codependent. I think we need space.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Space?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Space.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Well, I don't want space.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I know, it'll be very rough.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I don't know why you're saying all this. I feel like it's because of Darian.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Nope. Nope. Not at all why.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I feel like it is. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: No. Anyway, this is good, we'll just give each other some breathing room and... uh... touch base sometime in the future, I guess? Krista sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine approaches the school's concert hall when she gets TEXT from Krista: "WHERE R U? WAITING 4 U 4 LUNCH."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista waits under their tree, gets a text back from Nadi

dialogues.speaker: "SORRY. HAVE PLANS."
dialogues.text: She's shakes her head, clicks off her phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the concert hall, Nadine finds a couple of BAND MEMBERS practicing, Erwin taking his FLUTE out of its cas

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: So this is where you eat lunch. I never knew.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Oh hi. Hey. Yeah, we practice in here sometimes. These are my friends, Brandon and Boyd. BRANDON and BOYD, 16, are identical twins. Blonde, lanky, Rosacea-faced. They're not dressed the same, but close.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Hey, has anyone told you guys you kinda look alike? They just stare blankly at her.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Interesting how much better that joke was in my head.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: We can go somewhere else if you want. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: No, no, practice. I brought my burrito.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Oh... well, I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Don't be nervous, I won't look at you, I'll just stare at my feet if that helps.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Uh... alright. As Erwin gets up his nerve, Nadine finds a seat in the theatre, pulls out her burrito. Erwin starts out slow, th gathers confidence, until finally breaking into an awesom rendition of Come on Eileen by Dexy's Midnight Runners. H jams on it, adding a badass beat-boxing element. Nadine drops her burrito, watching him in awe. It's absolutely fucking incredible. When he finishes, she give him a standing ovation.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Holy shit, are you kidding me, Erwin?! He kicks the ground, bashful.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Oh, be quiet... (then) Wait, you mean that in, like, a good way, right?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I can't believe you just beat-boxed on that thing. Who are you?!

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: That's a new technique I'm trying out.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I don't know how else to say this, but you have single-handedly made being a flautist insanely cool. Erwin smiles ear to ear, he could receive no bigger compliment.  65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine's still singing and snapping as she walks toward t SCHOOL BUS pick-up.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Come on Eileen, oh I swear what he means, at this moment you mean eeeeevverythinnnnng... Just then, she spots Krista across the parking lot, kissi Darian goodbye. He heads off to football practice, and ju into Heather's waiting CONVERTIBLE with FOUR OTHER POPULA GIRLS. Heather turns up her music and the girls hoot and cheer as they screech off. Nadine suddenly feels like absolute crap, a lump gatherin her throat. Not only is her plan not working -- it's completely backfiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darian is lifting weights in the garage when Nadine burst through the door, announces:

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Krista has dandruff!

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: There's a Costco-size bottle of Head and Shoulders in her shower, if you don't believe me. If she doesn't use it? Flakes the size of shaved coconut. Not exaggerating. Darian sets down the weights, sensing what this is.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Nadine, I know exactly what you're doing and it's not--

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: In the 7th grade, she had chronic bacne. He starts pushing her out of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Get out. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: People used to call her Unusually Lot Of Bacne Person. Nobody even took the time to give her a clever name!

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Nadine-- He's forcing her out the door.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: One time, she ran out of pads and used her dad's tube sock! He's got her out of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: G'bye!

dialogues.speaker: TUPPERWARE CONTAINER
dialogues.text: This tidbit makes Darian pause a beat. Then he slams the on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine tosses and turns in bed, unable to sleep because s can hear Darian on the phone with Krista. He's giggling a doing a little cutesy-wootsey voice. She finally throws a BOOK at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You've been on the phone for 2 hours. And stop doing that baby voice, you're a grown freaking man! He just giggles louder. She gives up, switches on her TV, turns the volume up to drown him out. Flipping through channels, she lands on the 1970's film, Carrie. She's about to change it, but then something about it intrigues her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine finds Krista at her locker. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you about something.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Oh you mean like an actual conversation? Not just rushing me off the phone or disappearing on me?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I know, I'm sorry. But I figured something out last night. Something big.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I'm worried you'll freak out when I tell you, though, because it's really unfair to you and it might involve pig's blood.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: It might involve pig's blood?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: And worse possibly. Fires. John Travolta's car exploding.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about, Nadine.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen the movie, Carrie?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I've never even heard of that movie.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: So there's this girl, Carrie, and she's all dicked up 'cause her mom's a psycho and makes her read the bible 20 hours a day or some shit, I missed the beginning. But the point is, there are these prick popular kids who think it's funny to befriend her and act like she's one of them. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The hottest guy in school starts dating her and everything. But it's all one big set up. And the next thing Carrie knows, she's at the prom drenched in blood and her eyeballs go all freaky and she murders like a bajillion people.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: And so you're saying?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: That -- and I'm sorry because I know this sucks to hear -- Darian's been screwing with you, Krista. Krista just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You think he asked me to be his girlfriend as a dare, basically.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Or probably to get back at someone. Or to make someone jealous. And probably that girl with the curly fry pubes is my best guess. Krista's conflicted.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Seriously. You don't deserve this and I'm so sorry. Krista swallows, suddenly feeling sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista is

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Why would you ever believe that? My sister's an imbecile, you know her well enough to know that. upset, holding back tears. They creep behind a bush for privacy, but kids still eye them on their way to clas

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Well, it sorta makes sense though, especially considering...

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Considering what? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: The way Carly acts all in love with you and is always such a huge bitch to me!

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: And you think that means I like her?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I don't understand why you don't like her! She models, she's in every single yearbook photo, she's got those big perfect boobs that every guy dreams of!

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: And she's psychotic! And she's on 50 anti-depressants! And those big perfect boobs aren't even real!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: They aren't?

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: No, they are, I just thought that would help my argument. Krista's not in the mood.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, you know what? I'm taking care of this right now. He shuts his locker, angry.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: But the bell already rang.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Just follow me. Darian stomps off, Krista hesitates a moment, then follow after him. He heads into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darian marches right past MR. PERRY (40's) who's writing something on the chalkboard. Nadine studies a PLASTIC UTE (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: What are you doing? You can't just walk in here and interrupt our learning!

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: (to the teacher) I'm borrowing her for a second.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: He doesn't have a hall pass, Mr. Perry! He's hurting my finger! Oh god, he has me in a choke hold! Mr. Perry just shrugs and turns back to his blackboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them burst out the doors, Darian still has her head lodged under his armpit.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (noticing Krista) What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Apologize and tell her you're a dumbshit for what you said.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I'm not telling her crap!

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Tell her mom ate too much soft cheese when she had you, and that's why you're a retard and a dumbshit.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Fuck you, she never cared for soft cheese and you know it! Nadine tries to kick his shins. Darian squeezes tighter. Krista looks on, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Darian, let go of her, don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Tell her you're sorry for making up stories about crapping in Tupperware! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Krista's eyes bulge. What did he just say?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Stop it, let go of me! He finally lets go.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: I'm going to class. He walks off, leaving Krista and Nadine standing there. Nadine straightens her clothes.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot for the help there, my neck's about to be snapped and you're like-- (imitates, eyes her nails) Wow, I should really get my cuticles cut...

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You told him about the tupperware?!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: What? I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Why would you tell him that?!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I don't know, it just...slipped out in conversation.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Did you at least say it was your fault, because you refused to pull over?!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Because I was trying to get to Harry Potter on time because they're your favorite movies!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: God, you are unbelievable. I'm so sick of this bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh whatever, you love every minute! Oooh, I have five million new Facebook friends, look at me, I'm hot shit all the sudden! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You just can't deal with the fact that I'm actually happy and have a boyfriend and a couple friends other than you!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh right, get over yourself!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You get over yourself! I'm so tried of kissing your ass and begging you to be okay with me and Darian, I don't give a shit anymore! I'm done!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Good, you think I give a crap?! I'm done, too! D-O-WN! (realizes)

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Krista stalks off. Nadine watches her go, a lump gatherin her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erwin nervously fusses with the radio, adjusting the volu

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Is my talk radio too loud for you? Nadine has the passenger seat reclined to the horizontal position, her jacket over her face.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: It's fine. Erwin eyes her anxiously, not sure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Do you want some food? I have a Rice Krispie Treat in my glovebox, I can check if it's expired?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: No. Nadine pulls the jacket off her face, looks over at him.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you have to deal with me, Erwin. You're always so nice. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It makes me feel like a horrible person.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: You're not horrible.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I'm not good like you. I steal from the nut bins at Vons... I don't really like old people...

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: I'd steal nuts. I'd totally steal a nut. Nadine looks off, heaves a sigh.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I want to just leave and run away and move to Alaska... Erwin looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista sits with Heather and the other popular girls, sip Frappuccinos and studying. She can't concentrate, the fig with Nadine replaying in her head. Heather notices.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You okay? Did you have too much caffeine and now you can't concentrate and it's making you fidgety and frustrated and also a little horny in a weird way?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Um. I think I just have a lot on my mind.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Hmmm. Krista shakes it off, tries to focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Mona and Jerry make dinner, Nadine is splayed out o the living room floor, hollow eyes gazing hopelessly at t popcorn ceiling. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: I'm not sure you want to lay on the carpet, I haven't vacuumed up the cat hair in a while.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Come on, Nader, why don't you make the hummus for me? We could use some help.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Please don't call me Nader, it's too close to neuter, I don't like it. Mona shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: You're so sensitive lately. Nadine's phone rings: KRISTA. She immediately snaps out o her coma, takes the phone and runs out to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine tries to figure out how she's going to play this. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (Mad Men voice) Good afternoon, Draper residence. Krista rolls her eyes, plays along. INTERCUT with her out Starbucks.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Hi Betty, it's Joan. Just called to say I boned your husband because my boobies are massive and it's what we've all been waiting for.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I believe you have the wrong number. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Nadine, wait. I'm sorry for what I said, I feel really bad about it, I can't think about anything else. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine softens, drops the act.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I know, me too... I'm really sorry I told him about... the incident. I kinda spilled the beans on some other stuff, too, I feel really guilty...

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I don't know if I want to know.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Probably not.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I think maybe it would help if we spent some time together, you know? Quality time, just you and me, like the olden days.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I'd really like that.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: How about this weekend?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Great. Sounds like a dealio. (beat) Punch me if I ever say "sounds like a dealio" again, ‘kay? Krista laughs.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: ‘kay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine and Erwin walk and talk.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Well, that's really positive.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think so.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: It's like the saying, "Sometimes it takes a big fight to move along and repair things and get all better and stuff..." 75. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: That doesn't sound like a saying.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: It's...a Korean proverb. He's the worst liar ever. Absolutely terrible.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (rolls her eyes, laughs) I love you, Erwin. Erwin grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A campy throw-back restaurant with WAITRESSES IN POODLE SKIRTS, ON ROLLERSKATES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine and Krista follow the HOSTESS, slide into the boot sit, just look at each other. It's almost like a first da

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Well, here we are.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Here we are...

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Just you and me.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You and me.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So... what's new with you?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Not much. What's new with you as long as it doesn't have to do with Darian, fun things you've done together, the flagpole, or Darian?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I guess not much either then. They just stare at each other for a few more beats, not m more to say. Krista clears her throat, picks up the menu.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tuna melt sounds good... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh god, you're reading off the menu because we have nothing to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: No I'm not, I just like tuna melts.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Since... I don't know. Recently?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (Dramatic soap opera voice) It's like we don't even know each other anymore... Krista laughs.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Your hair looks good by the way.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Really? I'm wearing a Bump-it.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Your head looks amazing. Huge and amazing.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You always know the exact right thing to say to me. Krista laughs.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, I gotta see how our hotdog suits turned out. She's done with them, right?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Um, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I just hope they don't chafe or get a billion degrees, you know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: (hesitates a sec) Yeah, well, uh -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Before she can finish, the WAITRESS roll over.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: So what are we having, ladies?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Dos tuna melts and Dr. Peppers please. (clarifies) Dos is Espanol for two. The waitress gives her a look. You think I don't know tha

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh. And Espanol is Spanish for Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: (beat) Thank you. She rolls away. Nadine leans across table, lowers her voi

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: That's my new thing I do, I tell people really obvious shit like they don't know it. That nice green stuff outside is called 'grass.' It keeps me entertained. Krista laughs at how weird this is.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I've missed you, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista keys their bowling names into the score board. Nad walks up with a couple of DRINKS.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Awww yeah, take a sip of this.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: (takes a sip) Woah, how'd you...?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (smiles big) I made friends with the bartender.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: That guy? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Krista eyes the CREEPY-LOOKING BARTENDER. He waves.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: All we have to do is take some pics in his van later.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Sounds perfectly safe to me. They clink glasses, having fun. Nadine picks up her ball.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Alright God, if I get a strike right now, it means Hot Soccer Dan will be my future husband and Krista will one day pee-pee and wipe her you-know with hundred dolla billz. Nadine goes for it. It veers to the left, then back to th right, aaaaaand.... STRIKE!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Hhhhhoooooca000! !!!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (victory arms) Double rainbow across the sky! They high-five each other, dance around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Krista does a few twirls and throws the ball with much pizazz. It goes right into the gutter. --Nadine tosses the ball backwards through her legs, it bounces into another lane, knocking somebody else's ball course. --The BARTENDER slides two White Russians in front of the girls, winks. --Krista gutterballs it again. This time, she runs after pulls it out, and bowls it again from the middle of the l --Krista throws a spare. She and Nadine lock arms, doing square-dance jig. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: --Krista and Nadine pretend to ice skate in their slipper bowling shoes. --Krista and Nadine are now bowling with the ROUGH-LOOKIN OLD COUPLE next to them who wear matching bowling shirts FLAMING BALLS AND PINS. Another round of DRINKS. --The old man shows Krista proper bowling form, while the woman takes Nadine on a tour of her numerous tatoos. --Nadine and Krista are wearing the old couple's BOWLING SHIRTS now, all four of them with their arms around each other, swaying and singing Creedence Clearwater's Have Yo Ever Seen The Rain at the top of their lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls help the couple into their 1980's MOTORHOME.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You guys are invited to the holidays, I just want you to know.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: And next time we're all getting matching tattoos.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Yes! Badass ones. A dragon giving it to a beaver or something. (beat) I'm just gonna leave it to the tattoo artist. Nadine closes the door, they wave and drive off. Krista shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Oh, what a night.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (sings) Oh what a night! Da da da da back in '63!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: (sings along) What a very special time for me!

dialogues.speaker: AS I REMEMBER, WHAT A NIGHT
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Gayest song ever.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: How do we even know that song?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Because we're humongous gaylords. It's official, they're back in their old BFF swing.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Krista, no way, what are you doing here? They turn around to see Heather and her 4 popular friends approaching. Nadine's demeanor immediately shifts.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Oh, hi. We're just leaving. This is my best friend, Nadine. Nadine, this is Heather, Jen, Emily, and Sienna. Nadine smiles awkwardly, suddenly feeling very uncool.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Hola... They all wave and say hi.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Hey, so did you end up getting that dress you tried on or what?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Um... (glances at Nadine) Yeah. Yeah I did.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Cool, and Futch's Uncle's gonna pay for our limo 'cause he's super- loaded and wants to fuck Jen. Jen nods. That's right.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Oh good. Great.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Anyway, we're meeting up with the guys, but we'll see you later? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Yeah, have fun. As they walk off, Krista turns to Nadine, not sure what t say.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Dress...? Limo?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Well, uh --

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You're going to prom with them instead then.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Nadine, I--

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Screw you, I don't want to go with you anyway! Nadine starts speed-walking away, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Nadine. Wait! NADINE! Nadine walks faster, then turns around, adds--

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You know what? I hope your new friends still think you're cool after they get a load of the way you dance! Nadine imitates, doing robot-hands and humping the air wi goofy facial expression.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's how it looks. I never wanted to tell you. Krista doesn't know what to say, kind of stung. Nadine tu around, keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine wanders up to her house. He feet are completely blistered from the long walk. Ouch, ouch, ouch, ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drags herself down the hallway, into --
Her room is dark. She flips on her lights and sees Krista sitting on her bed, waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Ew. That was creepy!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Give me a chance to explain.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I don't want hear it.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I was gonna tell you, I was gonna ask you to go with us.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh kiss my ass! We had plans and you just flushed them down the toilet without a second thought!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: That's not true, I had the suits made and everything, I was planning on it and then--

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: And then--

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: And then what, Krista?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: And then I realized I don't want be a freaking hotdog for prom! I don't want to act like it's just some big joke to me! I want to wear a dress and do my hair and I want to go with an actual date, not you! This hits Nadine where it hurts.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Get out. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it like--

dialogues.speaker: GET OUT OF MY ROOM
dialogues.text: Nadine grabs her by the shirt and pushes her towards the door. Krista screams. Darian opens his bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?! Nadine keeps pushing her down the hallway. Krista starts cry, runs off down the stairs. The front door SLAMS.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus! What is your problem? Nadine fights back tears.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Why'd you have to do it, Darian? You have everything in the world, why'd you have to take my one friend, too? Darian pauses. He never thought of it like this.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Nadine... She runs back to her room, shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we left off from the opening scene. Nadine unzips h large DUFFLE BAG and begins to unload the contents, inclu TWO MASSIVE FOAM HOTDOG SUITS. She gathers it all up in h arms, ready to toss it in. A passing JOGGER sees her.

dialogues.speaker: JOGGER
dialogues.text: Excuse me, that's polluting. You can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: What, you're gonna call the cops on me? Go ‘head. He takes his CELL PHONE out, starts dialing. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah, crap. She quickly shoves it all back in the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista keeps calling Nadine, but Nadine keeps pressing IGNORE. Ring, ignore. Ring, ignore. Ring, ignore. It's li little dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista passes Nadine in the hallway. She tries to talk to her, but Nadine walks right on by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine de-friends Krista on Facebook. Then un-follows her Twitter. Then logs onto MYSPACE -- a billion blinking POP ADS clog the screen, it's a total assault on the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhh! Make it stop! She can't handle it, immediately closes out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Erwin practices the flute, Nadine plays Sudoku with twins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista knocks on Nadine's door again and again. Nadine wo open it, turns ANIMAL PLANET up to an obnoxious volume to drown her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The popular group is laughing and having a good time, but Krista's mind is somewhere else. Darian squeezes her hand checking if she's alright. She nods, but this is taking a toll on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The penis tree has been all alone for weeks now. Two NERD FRESHMAN BOYS walk by. They point and laugh at the carvin then noticing the spot is now vacant, claim it as their o (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: That's it -- there's no going back now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole class has their MICROSCOPES out for an experime where they put a piece of hair on a slide and alter it wi chemicals.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Hey, um, come check out this crazy thing I found in my microscope.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: What do enzymes do to the hair again? Turn it to goo or something?

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Sorta, but just come look real quick. You have to see this. Nadine goes over and looks into his microscope. Spelled o in pieces of ERWIN'S HAIR are the words WILL YOU PLEASE G

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh my god. How'd you do that?! Erwin smiles, super proud of himself.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: It was extremely hard, I worked on it for three weeks.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Wow, that's amazing!

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: I know it's last minute, but... will you? Erwin's smile is massive and sincere. Nadine suddenly fee uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh. Um... Erwin, that's so nice of you... His smile starts to fall, sensing where this is going. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The thing is, I just... I don't think prom's really my thing, I wasn't planning to go. Erwin swallows, his heart suddenly in his throat. Just th Nadine overhears the GOSSIPY GIRL talking on her cell pho

dialogues.speaker: GOSSIPY GIRL
dialogues.text: Wait, did she dump Darian or did Darian dump her?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (trying to hear) What? What'd she say?

dialogues.speaker: GOSSIPY GIRL
dialogues.text: (covers phone, tells lab partner) Krista dumped Darian! They're not going to Prom tomorrow, she returned her dress and everything!

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: What?! She did?!

dialogues.speaker: LAB PARTNER
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: GOSSIPY GIRL
dialogues.text: I don't know, something about a girl! (into phone) What girl? Who's this girl? (beat, announces) She forgets her name but she's hairy and kinda looks like a human- version of Alf?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Oh my god! I'm hairy and look like Alf! It's totally me!

dialogues.speaker: GOSSIPY GIRL
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: No, it really is! Oh my god, Erwin, can you believe this? Erwin can't say a word, still flattened from her rejectio  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine runs to find Krista. She's by her locker, Heather the girls gathered around consoling her. They see Nadine back off, giving them privacy. Krista's eyes are swollen.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Hey... I heard what happened. Krista wipes her nose, trying to hold it together.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I - I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Are we friends again then?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Krista, of course, I...

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: (bursts into tears) Good. She covers her face, runs off. Nadine is stunned. A littl ways down, Erwin is getting books from his locker.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: God, I think she's really upset. He doesn't respond, chucks his CHEM BOOK into his locker.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Do you know how long it took me to snip all those hairs and make them into little letters, especially the 'S' on 'please'?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Erwin--

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Sometimes you're so busy thinking about yourself, you-- you forget about everybody else. He shuts his locker, walks off. Nadine swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine sits, fully clothed, in her mom's empty whirlpool She picks through a BOWL OF POTPOURRI, staring in a deep void. Mona pokes her head in.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: What are you doing in here. Mona notices the tears in her eyes, comes in.

dialogues.speaker: MONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, based on the music Darian's playing, I can take a wild guess what this is about. Nadine looks off, heaves a sigh.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I feel awful... Mona walks over to the tub.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Mind if I join? Mona climbs into the empty tub next to Nadine. They just there silently a moment.

dialogues.speaker: MONA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Isn't this what you were after the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Not like this... Beat.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've never seen Krista cry like that before... it was so sad. And then Erwin, I even hurt Erwin, and he's the nicest person ever. Last week he had a spider in his car and felt too bad killing it so he just kept trying to shoo it out the window. It bit him like four times in the process... She shakes her head, thinking. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't know, mom... I just wanted things to be like they were, you know? When Darian came along it just changed everything. Mona puts an arm around Nadine, pulls her close.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Honey, being friends would be easy if everything always stayed the same... you always lived right down the street from each other, had the same hobbies, were single and not-— single at the same time. But you grow up and realize your lives aren't always going to intersect so neatly. Hell, next year you two may go off to different colleges... Couple years after that, maybe she's married with a baby while you're out freaking some Italian guy you just met at the club. Do they still call it "freaking" or is that over now?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Pretty sure that one's done.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: You get my point though. A lot of friendships can't handle change. But the good ones... they adjust. If you really care about each other, you find a way to make it work. Nadine lets this sink in. After a moment, she puts her ar around Mona, hugs her tight.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I love you, mom.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: I love you too, hon. (beat, looks around) I'm gonna take more baths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REM's "Everybody Hurts" wails from Darian's room. Nadine knocks. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gl.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: After a moment, he opens the door, turns down the music. eating a BEEF STICK (he's already eaten like 12) and look like a wreck.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I was an asshole. Darian sits down on the edge of his bed.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: I swear I never meant to mess up your life, Nadine.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Darian --

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: No, I'm serious. I really wish I would've fallen for somebody else, but I.... I can see why she's your best friend. She's amazing. Nadine can tell how sincere he is.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: You've gotta take her to prom tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: She doesn't want to go.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I have a plan to fix that. I kinda need your assistance, though.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: A ride some places, help with a few errands, and if you happen to know the lead singer of Radiohead and/or someone who does sky-writing?

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: (are you kidding me?) No.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Might have to switch some things around then. No biggie. Darian laughs, throws her a beef stick. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darian and Nadine burst through the mall doors, where the meet Heather, quickly follow her up the ESCALATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine follows Darian into the empty men's locker room.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: You can't tell anyone about this. Nadine locks her lips, throws away the key.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: So this is the guy's locker room..

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Exciting, huh.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Smells like taco seasoning. Darian approaches a STORAGE CLOSET labeled "FIELD

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Pretty sure it's in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darian idles outside PARTY CITY. Nadine runs towards him, arms loaded with SHOPPING BAGS. She jumps in, he zooms of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darian cuts the engine, quietly rolls up along Erwin's cu They quietly slide out of the car, creeping through the d Nadine dives onto the grass, crawling on her belly milita style.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: (whispers ) You think that's necessary? He's just walking normally.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I did at first, but this grass is really wet. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) ‘kay, that's poop, I'm getting up. She pops up. They tip-toe up the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darian and Nadine approach a crowded Persian Dance Club, line of CLUB-GOERS down the block. Even from the street, can hear the Persian singer WAILING AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: This is it?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: That's what mom told me... They get in line, both looking very nervous about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 2am. Nadine and Darian are exhausted. They give each other a tired high-five, Nadine collapses into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERWIN'S DAD opens the front door, bends down to pick up t NEWSPAPER when something across the front yard catches hi eye. He stands bolt upright.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN'S DAD
dialogues.text: (in Korean) Erwin! Get out here right now! Erwin comes to the door in his pajamas to behold: His MINI-VAN has been decorated with a million colorful streamers, balloons, confetti, the windows shoe-polished little stars and happy faces and messages like "Erwin freaking rocks!" A huge smile spreads across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine driving Darian's pick-up when her phone rings. Intercut between her and Erwin. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Did you happen to decorate my mom's van with a bunch of streamers and stuff?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Maybe. Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: It's pretty amazing.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: So...is it too late to change my mind about prom? Erwin clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: For you, madame, I just may grant an extension... (beat) That voice was kinda weird, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (laughs) I can't wait. Nadine clicks the phone off just as she pulls up outside KRISTA'S HOUSE, behind a parked MERCEDES. A person sittin the driver's seat waves to her. She waves back.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Show time. Nadine swallows, nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krista is folding laundry on her bed when she hears somet strange outside... It almost sounds like Radiohead's Karma Police, except something about it is not quite right. She moves to the open window, looks down to see she's bei serenaded by -- A PERSIAN MAN (45) -- big mustache, long pony tail, iridescent shirt unbuttoned to reveal copious chest hair gold jewelry. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He's standing below her window with a guitar, singing Kar Police in a very thick accent, about 10x more up-tempo, a with lots of little middle-eastern vocal trills. He tosses his hair and dances in place, feeling the rhyth During this performance, Nadine pushes a little machine o Krista's front lawn. It's a FOOTBALL FIELD PAINTER. She wheels it across the grass, spelling out he words "I'M SORRY." It's not sky-writing, but close. Krista can't help but laugh. The dude finishes the song a they both clap.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I wanted to get Thom Yorke but he wasn't available, and, well, my mom's cousin Hamayoun was. He's kinda awesome though, right?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: I can't believe you did all this.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (re: field paint) Don't freak out, it comes off. Oh, also-- Nadine pulls a DRESS BAG out of the pick-up: Krista's returned PROM GOWN.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have an appointment at the salon in 10 minutes. Krista grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK SHOTS of the two girls getting beautified by the sa LADY who waxes Nadine's mustache: 1. Nadine's nails are painted fire engine red. She makes little claw with her hand. Arrrrggh. 2. Krista lets out a series of yelps as her eyebrows get waxed. 3. Nadine's hair is flat-ironed, plumes of smoke coming o it. "Smoke is normal, right? Smoke is fine?" (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 4. Krista's thin blonde hair is ratted and curled piece b piece. 5. Nadine puckers her lips for lipstick application. 6. Krista holds still as the final false eyelash is glued

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadine is being sprayed with hair-spray when Krista walks of the back room, all ready: Dramatic make-up, hair in pi curls, a slinky floor-length electric blue dress. A whole 1950's Marilyn Monroe pin-up girl look.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Holy crap, you look hot.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: Wait, I just realized, what are you gonna wear?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I picked something up last night when we got your dress back. I might've lost my mind though. Nadine ducks into the other room just as Erwin's still- decorated minivan screeches up to the curb, streamers fly music blaring. Darian and Erwin hop out, both in tuxes, pumped up for the night.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Who's ready for proooommmm niiiiight?

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Awwwww yeah! We're gonna party on and on 'til the break of dawn! Or 'til we get tired! Nadine walks out in a SHORT, FUNKY, ZEBRA-PRINT DRESS. It style all her own, she looks awesome.

dialogues.speaker: DARIAN
dialogues.text: Wow, sis.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Is the zebra print too much? I was aiming for something between "I'ma party animal" and "I watch a lot of Animal Planet." What do you think? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Bullseye.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTA
dialogues.text: You look amazing. Nadine smiles.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.0)
dialogues.text: All in all, prom night turned out to be pretty big success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIVE BAND plays, everyone dances their asses off. Nadin Krista, Darian, and Erwin tear it up.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The food was good. Lotta white guys got drunk and thought they could breakdance. Futch tries to do a spin on his back, but just sort of awkwardly rolls around on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Erwin's friends seemed to be having fun, too. A few feet away, Erwin's twin buddies, Brandon and Boyd, wearing the HOTDOG SUITS and getting a shitload of attent from girls, including Carly Corvetti. She vigorously frea one of the hotdogs.

dialogues.speaker: CARLY
dialogues.text: Is that a foot long? He smiles huge. Nadine turns to Krista.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: I'll be right back, 'kay? She weaves through the crowd towards the LIVE BAND, when hand grabs her shoulder. She looks back to see the hand belongs to Hot Soccer Dan.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (freezes, flushed) Oh. Hi. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The moment has finally come. He looks her right in the ey

dialogues.speaker: HOT SOCCER DAN
dialogues.text: You...just stepped in vomit.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: (beat) Thank you so much. He nods and walks off. Nadine beams, cheerily stepping ou the barf.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yep. Things were really looking up. She heads towards the stage, whispers something to the LE SINGER of the band. He nods and they start to play Michae Jackson's Beat It. The crowd goes nuts. Nadine gestures to one of the twins, who pulls Erwin's FL out of his hotdog suit, hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: ERWIN
dialogues.text: Whoa. ..what?

dialogues.speaker: NADINE
dialogues.text: Why don't you show these assholes who's boss. Erwin's a deer in headlights. Nadine smiles, urging him o After a moment, he starts tentatively playing along. A sm crowd gathers. He gains confidence and the crowd gets big and bigger until everyone at prom is watching him tear it beat-boxing like a badass. A NERDY LITTLE PROM-GOER looks at the massive cheering cr disappointed in himself.

dialogues.speaker: NERDY PROM-GOER
dialogues.text: I should've never quit flute...

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: From there the night was kind of a blur, but went something like this:

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We danced a bunch more. 1. Krista does her famous humping-robot dance. 2. Nadine dances with a hotdog. 3. Erwin and Darian whip their hair Willow Smith's Whip My Hair.  99.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We took some pictures. INSERT: Series of funny, awkwardly-posed prom photos.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They played the last song.

dialogues.speaker: BAND'S LEAD SINGER
dialogues.text: Last song, party people!

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT--
dialogues.text: Everyone's arms are locked, singing along to Bye Bye Miss American Pie.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Some chicks cried. As they sing along, several girls weep. "School's almost over..." Even Nadine & Krista fight a tear.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We decided to go to Denny's. They walk into Denny's. At 3am, it looks like the runway the apocalypse. Every patron seems vaguely suicidal.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We decided not to go Denny's.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We finally made it back home. They pile out of Erwin's van with bags of In-n-Out.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And as I drifted off to sleep that night-- They're spread across the living room in sleeping bags, everyone passed out except Nadine. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Erwin drooling peacefully on the decorative pillow next to me, Krista and Darian snoring in perfect sync... I was overcome with a rare but unmistakable feeling: A small, almost undetectable smile comes across her face.

dialogues.speaker: NADINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Things were pretty alright. As Nadine's eyes flutter shut, we--- FADE OUT. THE END.
